 38/// These generate char tags for given data types, defaulting to int
 39/// with specializations for common floating point types.  These use
 40/// BLAS/LAPACK convention.
 41template <typename T> 
 42struct Type_name    { static char const value = 'I'; };
 43
 44#define VSIP_IMPL_TYPE_NAME(T, VALUE)		\
 45template <>					\
 46struct Type_name<T > { static char const value = VALUE; };
 47
 48VSIP_IMPL_TYPE_NAME(float,                'S');
 49VSIP_IMPL_TYPE_NAME(double,               'D');
 50VSIP_IMPL_TYPE_NAME(std::complex<float>,  'C');
 51VSIP_IMPL_TYPE_NAME(std::complex<double>, 'Z');
 52
 53#undef VSIP_IMPL_TYPE_NAME
 54
 55
 56template <typename T> 
 57struct Scalar_type_name    { static char const value = 'i'; };
 58
 59#define VSIP_IMPL_SCALAR_TYPE_NAME(T, VALUE)	\
 60template <>					\
 61struct Scalar_type_name<T > { static char const value = VALUE; };
 62
 63VSIP_IMPL_SCALAR_TYPE_NAME(float,                's');
 64VSIP_IMPL_SCALAR_TYPE_NAME(double,               'd');
 65VSIP_IMPL_SCALAR_TYPE_NAME(std::complex<float>,  'c');
 66VSIP_IMPL_SCALAR_TYPE_NAME(std::complex<double>, 'z');
 67
 68#undef VSIP_IMPL_SCALAR_TYPE_NAME
 69
 70
 71
 72/// Traits classes to determine the ops for a particular operation.
 73template <template <typename> class UnaryOp,
 74	  typename                  T1>
 75struct Unary_op_count
 76{
 77  static unsigned const value = 0;
 78}; 
 79
 80template <template <typename, 
 81                    typename> class BinaryOp,
 82	  typename                  T1,
 83	  typename                  T2>
 84struct Binary_op_count
 85{
 86  static unsigned const value = 0;
 87}; 
 88
 89template <template <typename, 
 90                    typename, 
 91                    typename> class TernaryOp,
 92	  typename                  T1,
 93	  typename                  T2,
 94	  typename                  T3>
 95struct Ternary_op_count
 96{
 97  static unsigned const value = 0;
 98}; 
 99
100
101/// Specializations for Unary types
102#define VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(OP, TYPE, VALUE)	\
103template <typename T>					\
104struct Unary_op_count<expr::op::OP, TYPE>		\
105{							\
106  static unsigned const value = VALUE;			\
107}; 
108
109//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(acos)
110//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(arg)
111//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(asin)
112//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(atan)
113VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Bnot,  T,            1)
114VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Ceil,  T,            1)
115VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Conj,  complex<T>,   1)
116VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Cos,   T,            1)
117VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Cos,   complex<T>,  12)
118//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(cosh)
119//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(euler)
120//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(exp)
121//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(exp10)
122VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Floor, T,            1)
123VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Imag,  complex<T>,   0)
124VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Lnot,  T,            1)
125//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(log)
126//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(log10)
127VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Mag,   T,            0)
128VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Mag,   complex<T>,  13)
129VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Magsq, T,            3)
130VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Neg,   T,            1)
131VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Real,  complex<T>,   0)
132//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(recip)
133//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(rsqrt)
134VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Sin,   T,            1)
135VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Sin,   complex<T>,  12)
136//VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(sinh)
137VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Sq,    T,            1)
138VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Sq,    complex<T>,   5)

148/// Specializations for Binary types
149#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(OP, TYPE1, TYPE2, VALUE)	\
150template <typename T1,					\
151          typename T2>					\
152struct Binary_op_count<expr::op::OP, TYPE1, TYPE2>	\
153{							\
154  static unsigned const value = VALUE;			\
155}; 
156
157#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(OP, TYPE1, TYPE2, VALUE)	\
158        VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(OP, TYPE1, TYPE2, VALUE)
159
160VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Add,  T1,          T2,          1)
161VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Add,  T1,          complex<T2>, 1)
162VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Add,  complex<T1>, T2,          1)
163VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Add,  complex<T1>, complex<T2>, 2)
164VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Sub,  T1,          T2,          1)
165VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Sub,  T1,          complex<T2>, 1)
166VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Sub,  complex<T1>, T2,          1)
167VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Sub,  complex<T1>, complex<T2>, 2)
168VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Mult, T1,          T2,          1)
169VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Mult, T1,          complex<T2>, 2)
170VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Mult, complex<T1>, T2,          2)
171VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Mult, complex<T1>, complex<T2>, 6)
172VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Div,  T1,          T2,          1)
173VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Div,  T1,          complex<T2>, 2)
174VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Div,  complex<T1>, T2,          2)
175VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS(Div,  complex<T1>, complex<T2>, 6)
176
177//VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(atan2)
178VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Band,    T1,          T2,           1)
179VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Bor,     T1,          T2,           1)
180VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Bxor,    T1,          T2,           1)
181//VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(div)
182VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Eq,      T1,          T2,           1)
183VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Eq,      complex<T1>, complex<T2>,  2)
184//VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(fmod)
185VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Ge,      T1,          T2,           1)
186VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Gt,      T1,          T2,           1)
187//VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(hypot)
188//VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(jmul)
189VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Land,    T1,          T2,           1)
190VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Le,      T1,          T2,           1)
191VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Lt,      T1,          T2,           1)
192VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Lor,     T1,          T2,           1)
193VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Lxor,    T1,          T2,           1)
194VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Max,     T1,          T2,           1)
195VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Maxmg,   T1,          T2,           1)
196VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Maxmg,   complex<T1>, complex<T2>, 27)
197VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Maxmgsq, T1,          T2,           3)
198VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Maxmgsq, complex<T1>, complex<T2>,  7)
199VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Min,     T1,          T2,           1)
200VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Minmg,   T1,          T2,           1)
201VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Minmg,   complex<T1>, complex<T2>, 27)
202VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Minmgsq, T1,          T2,           3)
203VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Minmgsq, complex<T1>, complex<T2>,  7)
204VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Ne,      T1,          T2,           1)
205VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(Ne,      complex<T1>, complex<T2>,  2)
206//VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(pow)
207//VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(sub)
208
209#undef VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS_FUNCTOR
210#undef VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPS

213
214/// Specializations for Ternary types
215#define VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS(OP, TYPE1, TYPE2, TYPE3, VALUE)	\
216template <typename T1,						\
217          typename T2,						\
218          typename T3>						\
219struct Ternary_op_count<expr::op::OP, TYPE1, TYPE2, TYPE3 >	\
220{								\
221  static unsigned const value = VALUE;				\
222}; 
223
224#define VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(OP, TYPE1, TYPE2, TYPE3, VALUE)\
225        VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS(OP, TYPE1, TYPE2, TYPE3, VALUE)
226
227// Short synonym for above.
228#define VSIP_IMPL_TOF(OP, T1, T2, T3, VALUE) \
229    VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(OP, T1, T2, T3, VALUE)
230
231#define VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RRR(OP, VALUE) \
232    VSIP_IMPL_TOF(OP, T1,          T2,          T3,          VALUE)
233#define VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RRC(OP, VALUE) \
234    VSIP_IMPL_TOF(OP, T1,          T2,          complex<T3>, VALUE)
235#define VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RCR(OP, VALUE) \
236    VSIP_IMPL_TOF(OP, T1,          complex<T2>, T3,          VALUE)
237#define VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RCC(OP, VALUE) \
238    VSIP_IMPL_TOF(OP, T1,          complex<T2>, complex<T3>, VALUE)
239#define VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CRR(OP, VALUE) \
240    VSIP_IMPL_TOF(OP, complex<T1>, T2,          T3,          VALUE)
241#define VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CRC(OP, VALUE) \
242    VSIP_IMPL_TOF(OP, complex<T1>, T2,          complex<T3>, VALUE)
243#define VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CCR(OP, VALUE) \
244    VSIP_IMPL_TOF(OP, complex<T1>, complex<T2>, T3,          VALUE)
245#define VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CCC(OP, VALUE) \
246    VSIP_IMPL_TOF(OP, complex<T1>, complex<T2>, complex<T3>, VALUE)
247
248
249// The cost for ternary functions is computed by adding the costs for 
250// pure real, mixed real-complex and pure complex adds and multiples 
251// for the given equation:
252
253//  (t1 + t2) * t3
254//                            <  adds  >    <   muls   >
255//                            R   M   C     R   M     C
256VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RRR(Am, 1 + 0 + 0*2 + 1 + 0*2 + 0*6)
257VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RRC(Am, 1 + 0 + 0*2 + 0 + 0*2 + 0*6)
258VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RCR(Am, 0 + 1 + 0*2 + 0 + 1*2 + 0*6)
259VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RCC(Am, 0 + 1 + 0*2 + 0 + 0*2 + 1*6)
260VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CRR(Am, 0 + 1 + 0*2 + 0 + 1*2 + 0*6)
261VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CRC(Am, 0 + 1 + 0*2 + 0 + 0*2 + 1*6)
262VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CCR(Am, 0 + 0 + 1*2 + 0 + 1*2 + 0*6)
263VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CCC(Am, 0 + 0 + 1*2 + 0 + 0*2 + 1*6)
264
265//  t1 * t2 + (T1(1) - t1) * t3
266//                                 <  adds  >    <   muls   >
267//                                 R   M   C     R   M     C
268VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RRR(Expoavg, 2 + 0 + 0*2 + 2 + 0*2 + 0*6)
269VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RRC(Expoavg, 1 + 1 + 0*2 + 1 + 1*2 + 0*6)
270VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RCR(Expoavg, 1 + 1 + 0*2 + 1 + 1*2 + 0*6)
271VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RCC(Expoavg, 1 + 0 + 1*2 + 0 + 2*2 + 0*6)
272VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CRR(Expoavg, 0 + 0 + 2*2 + 0 + 2*2 + 0*6)
273VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CRC(Expoavg, 0 + 0 + 2*2 + 0 + 1*2 + 1*6)
274VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CCR(Expoavg, 0 + 0 + 2*2 + 0 + 1*2 + 1*6)
275VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CCC(Expoavg, 0 + 0 + 2*2 + 0 + 0*2 + 2*6)
276
277//VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(ma)
278//VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(msb)
279//VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(sbm)
280//VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR(ite)
281
282#undef VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RRR
283#undef VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RRC
284#undef VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RCR
285#undef VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_RCC
286#undef VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CRR
287#undef VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CRC
288#undef VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CCR
289#undef VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_CCC
290#undef VSIP_IMPL_TOF
291#undef VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS_FUNCTOR
292#undef VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_OPS
293
294
295/// Reduction to count the number operations per point of an expression.
296
297struct Reduce_expr_ops_per_point
298{
299public:
300  template <typename Block>
301  struct leaf_node
302  {
303    typedef Int_type<0> type;
304  };
305
306  template <dimension_type D,
307	    typename       T>
308  struct leaf_node<expr::Scalar<D, T> >
309  {
310    typedef Int_type<0> type;
311  };
312
313  template <template <typename> class Operation,
314	    typename Block,
315	    typename T>
316  struct unary_node
317  {
318    typedef Int_type<Unary_op_count<Operation, T>::value +
319                     Block::value> type;
320  };
321
322  template <template <typename, typename> class Operation,
323	    typename LBlock,
324	    typename LType,
325	    typename RBlock,
326	    typename RType>
327  struct binary_node
328  {
329    typedef Int_type<Binary_op_count<Operation, LType, RType>::value +
330                     LBlock::value +
331                     RBlock::value> type;
332  };
333
334  template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Operation,
335	    typename Block1,
336	    typename Type1,
337	    typename Block2,
338	    typename Type2,
339	    typename Block3,
340	    typename Type3>
341  struct ternary_node
342  {
343    typedef Int_type<Ternary_op_count<Operation, Type1, Type2, Type3>::value +
344		     Block1::value +
345		     Block2::value +
346		     Block3::value> type;
347  };
348
349  template <typename Block>
350  struct transform
351  {
352    typedef typename leaf_node<Block>::type type;
353  };
354
355  template <typename Block>
356  struct transform<Block const> : public transform<Block> {};
357
358  template <template <typename> class Operation,
359	    typename Block>
360  struct transform<expr::Unary<Operation, Block, true> >
361  {
362    typedef typename unary_node<Operation,
363				typename transform<Block>::type,
364				typename Block::value_type>::type type;
365  };
366
367  template <template <typename, typename> class Operation,
368	    typename LBlock,
369	    typename RBlock>
370  struct transform<expr::Binary<Operation, LBlock, RBlock, true> >
371  {
372    typedef typename binary_node<Operation,
373				 typename transform<LBlock>::type,
374				 typename LBlock::value_type,
375				 typename transform<RBlock>::type,
376				 typename RBlock::value_type>
377				::type type;
378  };
379
380  template <dimension_type                Dim0,
381	    typename                      LBlock,
382	    typename                      RBlock>
383  struct transform<expr::Vmmul<Dim0, LBlock, RBlock> >
384  {
385    typedef typename binary_node<expr::op::Mult,
386				 typename transform<LBlock>::type,
387				 typename LBlock::value_type,
388				 typename transform<RBlock>::type,
389				 typename RBlock::value_type>
390              ::type type;
391  };
392
393  template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Operation,
394	    typename Block1,
395	    typename Block2,
396	    typename Block3>
397  struct transform<expr::Ternary<Operation, Block1, Block2, Block3, true> >
398  {
399    typedef typename ternary_node<Operation,
400				  typename transform<Block1>::type,
401				  typename Block1::value_type,
402				  typename transform<Block2>::type,
403				  typename Block2::value_type,
404				  typename transform<Block3>::type,
405				  typename Block3::value_type>
406				::type type;
407  };
408};
409
410
411/// This generates the total number of operations per point in a given 
412/// expression.  It also computes the total number of points, as this
413/// information is needed to calculate the total number of operations.
414template <typename BlockT>
415struct Expr_ops_per_point
416{
417  static length_type size(BlockT const& src)
418  {
419    length_type size = src.size(BlockT::dim, 0);
420    if ( BlockT::dim > 1 )
421      size *= src.size(BlockT::dim, 1);
422    if ( BlockT::dim > 2 )
423      size *= src.size(BlockT::dim, 2);
424    return size;
425  }
426
427  static unsigned const value =
428    Reduce_expr_ops_per_point::template transform<BlockT>::type::value;
429};
430
431
432
433
434/// Reduction to generate a tag for the entire expression tree
435struct Reduce_expr_op_name
436{
437public:
438
439  template <typename BlockT>
440  struct transform
441  {
442    static std::string tag() 
443    {
444      std::string st;
445      st = Type_name<typename BlockT::value_type>::value;
446      return st;
447    }
448  };
449
450  template <typename BlockT>
451  struct transform<BlockT const> : public transform<BlockT> 
452  {};
453
454  template <dimension_type            Dim,
455	    typename                  T>
456  struct transform<expr::Scalar<Dim, T> >
457  {
458    static std::string tag() 
459    {
460      std::string st;
461      st = Scalar_type_name<T>::value;
462      return st;
463    }
464  };
465
466  template <template <typename> class O, typename B>
467  struct transform<expr::Unary<O, B, true> >
468  {
469    static std::string tag()
470    {
471      return O<typename B::value_type>::name() + std::string("(") 
472        + transform<B>::tag() + std::string(")");
473    } 
474  };
475
476  template <template <typename, typename> class Op,
477	    typename                      LBlock,
478	    typename                      RBlock>
479  struct transform<expr::Binary<Op, LBlock, RBlock, true> >
480  {
481    static std::string tag()
482    {
483      return Op<typename LBlock::value_type,
484	        typename RBlock::value_type>::name() + std::string("(")
485        + transform<LBlock>::tag() + std::string(",")
486        + transform<RBlock>::tag() + std::string(")"); 
487    } 
488  };
489
490  template <dimension_type                Dim0,
491	    typename                      LBlock,
492	    typename                      RBlock>
493  struct transform<expr::Vmmul<Dim0, LBlock, RBlock> >
494  {
495    static std::string tag()
496    {
497      return std::string("vmmul") + std::string("(")
498        + transform<LBlock>::tag() + std::string(",")
499        + transform<RBlock>::tag() + std::string(")"); 
500    } 
501  };
502
503  template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Operation,
504	    typename Block1,
505	    typename Block2,
506	    typename Block3>
507  struct transform<expr::Ternary<Operation, Block1, Block2, Block3, true> >
508  {
509    static std::string tag()
510    {
511      return Operation<typename Block1::value_type,
512	typename Block2::value_type,
513	typename Block3::value_type>::name() + std::string("(")
514        + transform<Block1>::tag() + std::string(",")
515        + transform<Block2>::tag() + std::string(",")
516        + transform<Block3>::tag() + std::string(")"); 
517
518    } 
519  };
520
521};
522
523
524/// This generates a tag for an expression in standard prefix notation
525/// where the operator is shown, followed by the list of operands in
526/// parenthesis.  The operator may be one of  the common binary 
527/// operators +,-,\*, and / or simply the name of the function.  User-defined
528/// expression evaluators will use one of 'unary', 'binary' or 'ternary' 
529/// for the function name.  The operand will be one of the letters 'S', 
530/// 'D', 'C', and 'Z' for views of those types (using the BLAS convention).
531/// Scalar operands use lower-case equivalents of the same letters.
532/// For example for matrices of single-precision values where A and B 
533/// are real and C is complex:
534///
535///  * `A * B + C`    -->  `+(*(S,S),C)`
536///  * `A * 5.f + C`  -->  `+(*(S,s),C)`
537///  * `A * (B + C)`  -->  `*(S,+(S,C))`
538template <typename EvalExpr,
539          typename BlockT>
540struct Expr_op_name
541{
542  static std::string tag(BlockT const& src)
543  {
544#if VSIP_IMPL_PROFILE_USE_TYPEID
545    return typeid(BlockT).name();
546#else
547    std::ostringstream  tag;
548    tag << EvalExpr::name() << " "
549        << BlockT::dim << "D "
550        << Reduce_expr_op_name::template transform<BlockT>::tag() << " "
551        << src.size(BlockT::dim, 0);
552    if ( BlockT::dim > 1 )
553      tag << "x" << src.size(BlockT::dim, 1);
554    if ( BlockT::dim > 2 )
555      tag << "x" << src.size(BlockT::dim, 2);
556
557    return tag.str();
558#endif
559  }
560};
561
562
563} // namespace vsip::impl
564} // namespace vsip
565
566#endif // VSIP_IMPL_EXPR_OPS_INFO_HPP
Generated on Wed Sep 30 14:29:45 2009 by
synopsis (version 0.12)
